content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can do it:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:AbstractFloat}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
```
In this code, we define a `FloatWithUnits` struct that takes an AbstractFloat and a String as parameters. We then define a `show` function that prints the value and unit of the struct in the format "value unit". The `Base.show` method is used to provide custom display behavior for types.
